channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CPI Report Shows Food Prices Rose Sharply in December
item.description: Beef, coffee and produce are among the items that have gotten more expensive recently, inflation data on Tuesday showed.

item.title: Scott Adams, Audacious Creator of the ‘Dilbert’ Comic Strip, Dies at 68
item.description: His chronicle of a corporate cubicle dweller was widely distributed until racist comments on his podcast led newspapers to cut their ties with him.

item.title: That Restaurant You Love Will Close One Day. What to Do?
item.description: Beloved places to dine out are portals to past versions of ourselves. But they keep disappearing.

item.title: California fire victims say fighting with insurance companies has delayed rebuilding
item.description: Wildfires last January destroyed communities around Los Angeles. Homeowners say recovery has been slowed by fights with insurers to get their claims p...

item.title: Gourmet Magazine Is Back. It’s Not Exactly Sanctioned.
item.description: The defunct food publication is re-emerging as a newsletter, with new leadership and zero approval from its original owner.

item.title: 'Fly, Wild Swans' is Jung Chang's painfully personal tribute to her mother
item.description: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes abou...

item.title: Minnesota sues over Trump's ICE enforcement. And, SCOTUS hears trans athlete cases
item.description: Minnesota officials sued the Trump administration over unconstitutional ICE conduct. And, SCOTUS hears two cases on whether states can bar transgender...

item.title: The EPA is changing how it considers the costs and benefits of air pollution rules
item.description: The EPA won't consider the economic costs of harms to human health, at least for now. Legal and health experts are concerned that the change could mak...

item.title: Trump Urges Iranians to Keep Up Antigovernment Protests
item.description: “HELP IS ON ITS WAY,” President Trump said on social media. He has threatened to intervene militarily on behalf of the protesters if Iran uses lethal ...

item.title: As Iran's protests continue, Israelis and Palestinians watch closely
item.description: There is broad support for the protests among Israeli officials, but Palestinians say they hope the Iranian regime stays in place and the protests die...

item.title: Trump Explores ‘Many Options’ for Dealing With Iran
item.description: President Trump is considering several options, including diplomacy and military force, for dealing with Iran, which has been rocked by violent protes...

item.title: Trump Urges Iranians to Keep Up Antigovernment Protests

item.title: Trump Says He Will Impose Tariffs on Iran’s Trading Partners: What to Know
item.description: If President Trump follows through, some of Iran’s biggest trading partners, including China and India, could be hit hard.

item.title: Prosecutors Seek Death Penalty for Former South Korea President
item.description: Former President Yoon Suk Yeol faces an insurrection​ charge after his failed attempt to put his country under martial law in 2024.

item.title: As Iran’s Government Tries to Quell Protests, Accounts of Brutal Crackdown Emerge
item.description: As many as 3,000 feared dead as witnesses describe government forces firing on unarmed protesters.
